website_summaries.verdict: Players team up to save humankind in this cooperative, globe-trotting game.
pros: The whole family can work together to fend off several dangerous diseases in this cooperative game where you win or lose together
Gameplay is straightforward yet challenging, and every round is different from the last
cons: More vocal players may end up dictating the group’s decisions

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Viruses killed  all.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for game night at my house in Seattle. It was stressful to learn, stressful to play. In the end, we ran out of player cards, while several cities were dying from various viruses, INCLUDING Covid-19. So we lost, and the world died. I think everyone was further stressed out by the end. Also, under our dim, incandescent colored lights, it was hard to differentiate blue from black virii, and blue from green meeples. I might wait til this Covid-19 thing blows over and everything is normal again.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Salas

customer_reviews.title: T.p.
customer_reviews.text: Omg I went to Costco today for t.p. and couldn’t get any because they were all out because people are getting crazy about the Coronavirus... buying up t.p., bottled water, flour, hand sanitizer, etc. like crazy. It was bonkers like first episode of your favorite apocalypse tv show where they set up the disaster. I came home and looked at this game sitting on the floor from Xmas, still unopened. I realized we might be playing it soon when we’re all stuck at home because the plague arrives, and thought that was pretty ironic. Maybe if it gets real bad there’s paper pieces we can use for t.p.
customer_reviews.author: MAtkinson

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun. But what's more fun?  Mix it up with a Monopoly set...
customer_reviews.text: ...and you get to play Pandemic: Private Equity Edition. In the new "market facilitator " role, you can - Collect Pharma IP, and the royalties when Medics land on your property - Be a middle-man for PPE-- just-in-time Logistics is the modern Railroad - First-line responders need to fix equipment? Do not pas GO. - Cut the pay of other players-- they can't quit, think of the children - Help the Bank distribute emergency funds-- for a service fee. Fun and cooperative (in a frog-and-scorpion way), with lessons for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: amazon_princessTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Helped kids with their fears about the current pandemic!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very smart, very well thought out cooperative game that can be adjusted in difficult level. I highly recommend it, despite the current circumstances, or perhaps especially in the current circumstances. My kids conquered their fears about our pandemic when we played this game, and learned that many different professionals work together in cooperation to combat a virus. They wanted to play it again and again, each time gaining confidence from beating the pandemic. As an added plus, kids also learn the location and population density of many cities around the world. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SweetLife

customer_reviews.title: The game is very realistic
customer_reviews.text: Played it once then the world went into an actual pandemic. We lost the game so I hope it’s not to telling of the future. Overall was pretty fun but wouldn’t recommend playing seems to manifest too much into reality. Not sure if im playing the game still or if this all is real. -1 for an actual pandemic being declared the next day.
customer_reviews.author: amosta

customer_reviews.title: Not fun
customer_reviews.text: We didn’t like this game. It was too complicated and not fun. We tried it multiple times to give it a chance but none of us could get into it. I don’t recommend this game.
customer_reviews.author: Adambomb

customer_reviews.title: This game is very fun!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this game to play together. My favorite part about it is that you work WITH the people you are playing with, not against them. It's pretty quick to get the hang of! We had it pretty much down after one game. Although it's not difficult to learn, it IS difficult to win. Honestly, we still haven't won. But, for us, that makes us want to play more and get better at it! If you want an easily winnable game, this might not be for you. However, if you want a fun and exciting challenge that allows you to plan and strategize with your friends, I definitely recommend this game!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: A little bit of work to get started- but super fun!
customer_reviews.text: I am NOT into board games, especially super complicated ones, so when my husband's friend pulled this one out during the holidays --I was dreading it. BUT to my surprise, it was really really fun! It DOES take a little bit of time to read all the instructions and learn how to play- but once you do, its totally worth it! I LOVE that the game is designed for everyone to play as a team against the pandemic; if you win-you all win, if you lose-you all lose. It was so much fun--We had to buy one for ourselves!
customer_reviews.author: A. M.

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: We took this in our camper for a week long vacation off the grid. The first game took us two hours of reading and stumbling through looking everything up in the directions. The second game took about 45 minutes. After a steep learning curve, we now have the hang of it and only occasionally have to stop and refer to the directions. Perfect for a mom, dad and teenager to play together. It says that you can play with two people, but that seems like it would be tough. We love that this game is cooperative and all players collaborate and win or lose together. Lots of opportunities for talking and reasoning.
customer_reviews.author: Alix McKee

customer_reviews.title: Incredible strategy game
customer_reviews.text: BEST GAME EVER for people who like strategy games. Sooo fun, love playing w my boyfriend over some drinks on a weeknight. Everyone is on the same team so a fun game to play together. Although if multiple super competitive people there may be some healthy debates!! Overall absolutely love this game. Not for those looking for a mindless way to kill time or play with new people often. A level of commitment to learning it but once you do, the most fun game you will ever play!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anabella Mowbray

customer_reviews.title: Wife's favorite game
customer_reviews.text: We love this game even if we aren't very good at it we've actually yet to beat it but every time it's the table we have a great time and I'd highly recommend it to anybody looking for a great co-op game
customer_reviews.author: wesley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cooperative strategic game!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love to play strategy games.. but it gets brutal. When we saw this was cooperative - us against the game - we were excited to try but didn't have high hopes. We have played it over 20 times in the last week and have celebrated our wins.. as well as sighed at our losses. If you love strategy but want to partner with your fellow gamers -this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great game for groups but not for beginners
customer_reviews.text: We bought this game for our family, who range in ages from 9 to 43. We enjoy this game because it is played as a co-op/group, instead of us against each other. Our 9-year-old even likes it because she joins one of the rest of us and can follow what is going on. The game is a lot of fun but very challenging. It is not for beginners. We have played it 4 times, and even on the easiest settings, we have lost each time. The directions are lengthy but easy to follow. After about 30 minutes, you are able to follow game play.
customer_reviews.author: William Wheelwright

customer_reviews.title: Great Entertainment!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were looking for a new game that could be played with two people, and this hit the mark! We played it 3 times in a row! It can be a little stressful to learn because all the details, but it’s worth it!!! Definitely recommend to all!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game! Not too complicated, once you get in the swing of it. I highly recommend watching one of the YouTube videos that can be found about setting up the game. Sounds messed up, but we like to give each of the diseases made-up names to refer to the hypothetical situations. Lots of fun with family and friends while considering how to save millions of people. Gets my nephews thinking about geography and medicine as well as strategizing practical considerations (the people in South America need help, so find the best way to get out of Europe, for example).
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: I love this game!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this game. I’ve played it dozens and dozens of times. My 7 year old and 9 year old love to play it just as much as I do. I think it takes some time to learn but once you get the hang of it you won’t want to stop. Most kids probably couldn’t play it but if your kids usually play above their level they will like this game. I like that every time you play it’s a little different because of the different character roles you use.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Brain Game
customer_reviews.text: Very fun game for cooperative, deep thinking players - you do not play against each other, everyone plays against the game. Takes 45mins-2hours depending on how analytical and conversational the players are between and during turns, number of players and game mode. Winning the most difficult game mode is extremely satisfying! Winning the easiest mode is a comfortable challenge - we have had 50% success rate in this mode. 8-12 yr olds can play this game but enjoyment will vary.
customer_reviews.author: TT. Krause

customer_reviews.title: Probably no longer enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a month before the actual pandemic happened. Now...it is collecting dust. I am not so sure I want to play it. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon B

customer_reviews.title: This game is great!
customer_reviews.text: Complex game that makes you really think and strategize. Had a blast the first time I played this with my husband and teen kids, and had to play agin the next day. It has varied skill levels and the role cards you draw at the start of the game make each time you play a little different and require a different strategy. I highly recommend this game!
customer_reviews.author: November Rainne

customer_reviews.title: Must...uh...save...uh...the world...
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for the super-great price of $24.99! It is a fun game and the whole family enjoys playing it (it is even engaging for my teenage daughters!). They actually put their phones down for the average hour of play. I received the updated version and the quality of the board, box, playing cards and pieces seem to be of good quality. There is a learning curve but once you get it, it is fun and strategic.
customer_reviews.author: Texas KnowHow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Game. Very Fun, but Complex
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best board games I've played. It's complex, but very interesting and fun. There are so many ways to conduct play, that I'm sure we'll be honing our strategy for a long time to come. We lost our first game, but we learned a ton, and we look forward to sharing the game with extended family over the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: The game itself is great, my 3 star review is given because I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: The game itself is great, my 3 star review is given because I'm pretty sure I was sold a counterfeit copy. Most of everything seems up to par, the issues I've noticed so far have been: 1) The edges on my cards were flaying after being shuffled once, granted they were "shuffled" by someone that shuffled by "smooshing", I would still expect the cards to be able to take a bit more abuse prior to falling apart. 2) The game board is missing some text, as if the counterfeit designer was abducted by Candlejack prior to finishing his work. 3) Th
customer_reviews.author: Logan D

customer_reviews.title: Confusing at first, fun once you get it down.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a lesson on cooperation during a group session. It was used with 11-14 year olds. Half of them absolutely loved it & asked to play it again. The other half declared it "too hard" & refused to participate. At first, there was a learning curve & I had to be the deciding factor in whether they were following the "rules". After that, they caught on fast & played many times by themselves. It was a really great way to teach cooperation as everyone has to work together to "win".
customer_reviews.author: AdieN

customer_reviews.title: This homeschooling mom recommends!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! This has been our summer go to game despite a closet of games. And if two people plan to play, you can bet anyone who is home will come running to get in on the action. It's easy and it's fun! Best of all I love that I can see the leaders in my boys come out. I like to play, but now I sit back and watch them take over directing the game play. They work together and work out disagreements. It's great for learning problem solving and team building skills. I think this is one of the games that relates to real life more than anyone is realizing. As a homeschooling mom I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Craftymom2boys

customer_reviews.title: Fun game.
customer_reviews.text: Being silly, I sent this to my niece. It's a fun game, we had a good time with it. It's cooperative, so if you have some who have a hard time losing, or are ungracious winners, this is a good one. 2-4 players work together to stop the spread and find cures for 4 viruses before one of the "game ending" events happens. Vendor delivered in a timely fashion, and in good condition
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Good but damaged
customer_reviews.text: Frankly i had a problem with one of event card and red cubes both are chipped from sides and red ones are opaque as oppose to other colors.camera cant really grab it but you can see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sceptical at first
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical when I bought it, received it, inboxed it, and even when I watched the video that explains how to set up the game,.... BUT this game is very interesting and also challenging. Playing it with 2 players (your partner) will bring you lots of fun and strategic thinking. You have to play it at least twice to feel comfortable and really understand the rules. Don't give up when unboxing and watching the video tutorial. You would otherwise regret it
customer_reviews.author: ja_ja

customer_reviews.title: A little complicated the first time you play it it but it gets easier the more you play
customer_reviews.text: Family loved the game. But understand it is a cooperative game so there's no 1 winner. The more you play the better you get at it requires a lot of teamwork and strategy. The first couple times you play it you're not sure if you're doing everything right but then it gets very interesting when you figure out all the rules our family of five loves it this includes me and my husband in our forties are younger children in their twenties and are much younger children in their teens
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: Great game, but it might not be the right time to play given the world right now.
customer_reviews.author: Laura G.

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: It's a really fun game, but I knew that going into this purchase. I assume most people on this page are also aware of this game's existence so we will just skip the "fun to play" "great for game night" stuff. Most importantly, this product arrived sealed and in perfect condition. I got exactly what I paid for and am very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: F0URTYK

customer_reviews.title: Pandemic to play during the pandemic
customer_reviews.text: Initially bought this for my husband's birthday as a joke since we are literally in a pandemic - I don’t think he thought it was very funny. We decided to give it a try and actually LOVE the game! Definitely would recommend and continue to okay on game nights!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Such a great game! I brought it home when I visited ...
customer_reviews.text: Such a great game! I brought it home when I visited for Christmas, thinking a cooperative game would reduce the number of board game related fights. While it wasn't a completely argument free experience, it was very well received by everyone from the teenagers to my parents. There's a bit of a learning curve, but the cooperative elements make it easy to learn as you play. I like the fact that it has a pretty fast gameplay, it's a lot easier to convince people to play a game when they know it won't take the whole afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Those Who Love A Little Pandemic Panic
customer_reviews.text: An awesome strategy, table-top game that requires team work to save humanity! I love the biodefense aspect and the aesthetic that's reminiscent to a reverse Plague Inc. board-game. Never have I seen my family work so hard together in a game and actually skip the arguing! Only complaint is the instructions that come with the game are really confusing, but a simple Google Search makes it easy to decipher. Over all a great game!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is a great game, but I haven't gotten into the right ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a great game, but I haven't gotten into the right rhythm yet even after playing 10 or so games. I know it's not in the same classification of board game, but I recently got Karuba and have gotten WAY more enjoyment out of that one. the coop element is cool; it's unique to a lot of people and that makes it fun. the game's difficulty can be discouraging but it is not unwinnable. if you are on a losing streak, try a team with Medic, Dispacher, and Researcher. all of the parts and pieces are very nice quality. I do suggest to keep the manual handy and read through twice before you start.
customer_reviews.author: niko

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is extremely fun and entertaining! It is a Teamwork game and i highly suggest you play with people who are team players and not overly bossy because it is very easy for someone to take control of the game and tell everyone what to do (which is not fun at all!). There is a lot of strategy involved and a good amount of chance too. Overall, I rank this game in my top 3 and a must have for any game library.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Cottrill

customer_reviews.title: Save the World or die trying!
customer_reviews.text: Myself and a group of friends recently started doing some game-nights to break up the week, so we review the "TableTop" YouTube channel quite frequently, and Pandemic was one that looked amazing! Absolutely love it. It's a very challenging game, 9 times out of 10 ending up loosing but it's great to play a cooperative board-game for once! Would highly recommend it! Bought it and the expansions that go with it below: Main Game:  In The Lab Expansion:  On The Brink Expansion:  State of Emergency:
customer_reviews.author: enigma.b17

customer_reviews.title: Fun board game
customer_reviews.text: Pretty fun game to play with friends. Lots of instructions for beginner to read and start the game. It’s better if you play with someone has experience, and it’s not very easy to beat the game. We either run out of cards or have too many outbreaks. I would recommend the Pandemic legacy which can played as normal game and play campaign once adopted to the rules.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Wu

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is really fun. I was hesitant about it at first because I hate games were everyone wins, or everyone loses together for that matter. But this game really makes you think, it’s super fun, and gives you that little bit of anticipation about what will happen next. We have played with our 10-year-old and up, I think you could play with younger especially if you help them.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Addictive, cooperative boardgame
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I can't stop playing this game! I look forward to purchasing expansion packs in the future. Pandemic is a fun, cooperative board game that requires a great deal of thought and strategy to play. I highly recommend finding some quick YouTube tutorials to get started, as it can be a bit difficult to figure out in the beginning. If you're looking for a new boardgame, you won't be disappointed with Pandemic! I should also add that the game was shipped within 3 days of ordering on Prime, which was much earlier than the expected delivery date. Thanks for the prompt shipping!
customer_reviews.author: IboughtThis

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: It’s a collaborative game which I really like! It’s fun for people who want to learn a more strategic game but also allows you to rely on other people who maybe have more experience. I wouldn’t say play this with a bunch of people who have never played. At least have someone who is experienced with playing a type of Pandemic. But still fun!
customer_reviews.author: Maricella

customer_reviews.title: Great Game We Play it Almost Everyday
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for board game players. Usually it is just my wife and I playing, but sometimes we invite friends over. The goal is to eradicate the diseases that are placed around the board at the start of the game. Each turn you draw and place more disease cubes and each player is assigned a role (their 10+ different roles in the game.) Each players role has special features to help win the game. You work together to win the game. This is actually the second Pandemic we bought because we actually wore out our original. Very addictive!
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect game for killing time during CoronaVirus
customer_reviews.text: Nothing less than the best board game of all time. Learned to play a few years ago with a friend. I didn't think I'd be able to get my wife into it until the real pandemic hit. She LOVES it and we play "virtually" over video chat with multiple other couples. The strategy is at the same time easy to learn and complex to master. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Not our fave
customer_reviews.text: This was too complicated to learn. I have four boys 11-19. The oldest just ended up telling the younger what to do in order to win for much of the game. We played once and not sure they will play it again.
customer_reviews.author: CROI400

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS GAME
customer_reviews.text: I am officially 100% obsessed with this game. At first, there’s a lot of nuances to grasp, but after the first play-through, we had them down. My boyfriend and I have introduced the game to some of our friends, and they all love it too! We are definitely planning on buying some expansion packs, but for now we’re content playing on the increased difficulty level that you can do with the original game. Definitely buy this if you’re considering it! I had it in my cart for a while, and I was so happy when I finally bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Dani L

customer_reviews.title: We love this game!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun! This cooperative game involves thinking, strategy, and working together. Every time you play, it's different, because the element of chance pops up with surprises at every turn. I don't usually like games all that much, but I thoroughly enjoy playing this one. All the players cooperate to try to stop the spread of diseases. Each has a specific role, and it's the players against the game. For people who like to blend chance with skill, it's a great game!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Maitland

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn, deep strategy
customer_reviews.text: Fun game. Very easy to learn. However winning? Yeah that's another story. It takes a lot of teamwork and a lot of thinking ahead to win at the easiest level. It is a lot of fun with great strategy involved. We play it as a 2 player game and it scales beautifully at that level. Highly recommended. If you do your research you'll see Pandemic show up on most "best game" lists.
customer_reviews.author: gm72

customer_reviews.title: I love this game for all of the same reasons that ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this game for all of the same reasons that everyone has so eloquently explained. I am just a little frustrated by the packaging and pieces though. I played this game with family this weekend and they had a version that had larger 3-D, translucent colored vials for each of the cures AND their cubes for the contagions were all in cool little plastic petri dishes. Apparently you can now buy those dishes separately but the game does not come with those upgraded pieces anymore. I'm a sucker for marketing, so I would much prefer the upgraded pieces and containers.
customer_reviews.author: khastings

customer_reviews.title: A great collaborative game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is so fun, especially if infectious diseases are horrifying but also fascinating to you. Unfortunately, it doesn't label which diseases you are working to cure (You can buy Pandemic: Iberia for that!) BUT it's still a lot of fun. You work together as a team so there is no bluffing or competition - it's truly you and your friends playing against a difficult scenario (levels vary) to cure the world of diseases! Super fun. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: TrtlBite

customer_reviews.title: Pandemic is a fun cooperative game
customer_reviews.text: Takes a bit to comprehend all the directions and each persons role. We lost the first 9 games until realizing we didn't need to eradicate - just had to cure - to win. Didn't think it would work well for just 2 people but it's almost better. In a cooperative game you need to be careful who you play with - some people don't take suggestions very well. Love the game and recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Martin

customer_reviews.title: Definitely one to add to your game collection!
customer_reviews.text: It is a complex game, but because you all play as a team, it's great for the whole family. It took us a couple of times to really get the hang of it, but it has quickly become a family favorite (our youngest is 7). You can increase the complexity as you become more experienced. Great for critical thinking skills, working as a team, planning several moves ahead, and even a little geography!
customer_reviews.author: Marina's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Finally! A board game my husband and I both love!
customer_reviews.text: So, I love playing board games but my husband generally isn’t a fan. He is into strategy games, which isn’t really my thing. However, this is a cooperative strategic game which makes it so much more fun! He wants to play it all the time and we have fun playing different variations and switching up the difficulty level. It never gets stale! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this game
customer_reviews.text: Great game and very replayable as you get very different outcomes. I love that it's cooperative and you can also make it hard as you'd like as well. The rules can be hard to remember at first but you'll pick it up quickly. If anyone beats this easily all the time, you're probably playing it incorrectly.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C.

customer_reviews.title: It is crazy fun, but very easy to lose.
customer_reviews.text: All players work together as a team to fight four spreading viruses before they spiral out of control and cause a pandemic. In my experience with playing this game, you could be fine on one player's turn and have lost the game by the end of the next player's turn. I bought this during the COVID-19 global pandemic of 2020, so it was perfect for the world's then-current situation.
customer_reviews.author: KyleCrotts

customer_reviews.title: Great game, easy to learn, and fun to play!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic co-operative board game for 2 to 4 players. All players work together to contain outbreaks, research cures, and eradicate the 4 viruses that are threatening major cities across the world. Simple mechanics and game play, but requires co-operative planning and teamwork to win. Plenty of character roles and randomness in the card draws to ensure plenty of replayability.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great game, 15 minutes to learn.
customer_reviews.text: Great game for four people. It is a co-op game, so you aren't playing against each other, but together to achieve a shared goal. Plenty of ways to lose, and you can adjust how many "epidemic" cards you include to change the difficulty. Each player has a different role, those roles give them special abilities: Scientist - one less card to cure a disease, Researcher - can give city cards without being in that city, Medic - treat disease with fewer actions, etc. It takes a bit to understand how to play, but once it clicks, you just get it, and it is a lot of fun. Highly recommend it, looking forward to picking up the expansions.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Utke

customer_reviews.title: Work together to share the fun
customer_reviews.text: Great game, love the cooperative approach. Played this with my wife while she was in the hospital, we had a great time together. The nurses thought it was hilarious to play this in the hospital!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Fisher

customer_reviews.title: This game is a fantastic group game!
customer_reviews.text: We were very impressed with the game Pandemic. The board and pieces are well designed. The overall play of the game is fun, challenging, and interactive. The only part that was confusing when learning how to play, was the role of the Researcher, and when and how he could use his character's advantage. My husband and I played with our 12 year old son and nephew (whom we bought it for for his birthday), and we all loved it! We will be buying it for our family now!
customer_reviews.author: JSe04

customer_reviews.title: Great replayability
customer_reviews.text: Great game. Lots of replayability due to different skills and ability to play with a variety of people. This is a classic game.
customer_reviews.author: Lippy

customer_reviews.title: The reference standard cooperative board game
customer_reviews.text: The theme will make sense right away. Cure disease to save the world. If you have any interest in cooperative board games, this is probably one of the best games to investigate. The best player count is three to balance difficulty. Four means the world will die often, while two often works but misses some of the fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: After a year of playing this...
customer_reviews.text: We've had this game a little over a year. Our family plays a lot of similar games like Dominion, Settlers of Catan, etc. This is good to occasionally pull out for a Sunday afternoon with the family and everyone likes it, but it hasn't become one of our "addictive" favorites. I would still highly recommend this. It's a good game, well made and well thought out. But it just doesn't pull us in quite as much as some of our other games. As a parent I very much like the fact that this is less competitive than other games, but that also seems to take a bit of the excitement out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Twlb

customer_reviews.title: New favorite game.
customer_reviews.text: Our family played this a lot over Christmas break and we loved it. I like how you become a team to defeat the game, not each other. It is fun to problem solve with your family/friends of how to beat the epidemic. Each game is different and provides a challenge. Loads of fun. My new favorite game.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: This game is a great team game!
customer_reviews.text: We've absolutely loved this game. You've got to invest some time at the beginning, but it is highly entertaining and enjoyable and we love working together to try and solve a challenge while learning about how pandemics can come about. Great game for older kids (8+) and adults of any age!
customer_reviews.author: Bama Fan

customer_reviews.title: Super fun, different game!
customer_reviews.text: This a fun game! Itbseems complicated at first but once you start playing it's easy to get the hang of it. We played with 4 people on easy mode and managed to win! Not good for little kids as there are lots of small pieces. So much fun, can't wait to play again!! I love that we all play on a team so we win together or loose together. Fosters teamwork instead of competition.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Work with friends, save the world
customer_reviews.text: Pandemic is a fun cooperative game that pins your group against the board and 4 diseases destroying the world. The game can be manageable to insanely difficult depending on how you set it up (number of epidemic Cards), the vocations of your players, and just pure luck. Pandemic can strengthen your leadership abilities, communication skills, and your strategizing. Grab 3 friends and rid the world of the deadly diseases. Bonus note: it is always fun to put a name to the diseases your curing— bird flu, AIDS, zombie apocalypse, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Poet Lunatic

customer_reviews.title: Just buy this game!
customer_reviews.text: My family loves board games but it has been awhile since we've had this much fun playing one! You will always have a great time playing this game, win or lose. The fact that it is team based and you all have to work together is the best thing about this game. It is well designed and easy to play/learn. If you're on the fence about it just buy it, you won't regret it at all!
customer_reviews.author: Macorey

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun if not a bit too topical
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our son who is a board game addict and he absolutely loved it. The game is pretty quick to pick up and is really challenging. It's cooperative and a lot of fun. Highly recommend it for game nights (assuming it's not currently hitting too close to home) especially if you need a game where everyone is working together. As for the product itself, all the pieces and the board itself are of pretty standard quality. About what you'd expect from a good quality board game. Absolutely no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Game Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this game I bought it for my brother this past Christmas. It is so much fun. I love the new role cards and a super nice thing about this game is that unlike other games were you try to win, you are a team of workers working together to cure the diseases before the diseases gets you. You make team building relationships and learn to work with other people. A down side to the game is that it takes over 15 minutes to set up. Its' a little confusing learning how to play from the instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Koni Smith

customer_reviews.title: This game is sick! (Pun intended)
customer_reviews.text: Kind of complicated (can be a learning curve for players that hate complicated and lots of rules ), but so so fun!! One of my favorite games! It's a great team building game since you either all win or lose. Pro Tip: We like to play the version where you have to not just 'cure', but eradicate all diseases for extended excitement and fun! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: M F Giesbrecht

customer_reviews.title: this game is becoming a game night favorite. it is so hard on normal difficulty
customer_reviews.text: this game is becoming a game night favorite. it is so hard on normal difficulty, or maybe we just aren't great. haha. but i think we've played about 6 times and won twice. the last couple games we were one or two disease cures away from winning and would hit an epidemic card that would screw us over and run us out of blocks or flip an infection card that would cause a chain reaction of outbreaks and kill us that way. all that work for nothing right at the end! oh well, it's a blast and we have a good time strategizing. definitely worth it and looking forward to the expansions.
customer_reviews.author: J. RecTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: Missing Infection Cards
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to receive this game based on all the positive reviews. When I did an inventory of the infection cards, I noticed that I was three short. Comparing them to the other cards, I realized I was missing Tokyo, Tapei and Sydney. It is clearly evident that the cards were wrapped to soon, since these were the last three cards in the deck. Hopefully the company does the right thing.
customer_reviews.author: Gharri9870

customer_reviews.title: My favorite game
customer_reviews.text: It’s a challenging game, but also my favorite board game (and I’m a broad game fanatic). It can be hard to understand right away, but after you play once or twice you’ll get the hang of it. It’s totally worth patiently learning. It’s a super smart game and thoroughly enjoyable to play with older children/teens or adults.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Great family game
customer_reviews.text: Great family game....teenagers and adults. My grandson suggested I get this for my granddaughter for Christmas. 18 yr old and 20 yr love playing it together. The family has frequent game nights and they all enjoy it. They have cabinets full of games, particularly board games, and this is one of their top two...the other being the Stettlers of Catan Series. Their favorite non-strategy game for the last couple of years is Hedbanz...fun for any age.
customer_reviews.author: Shopsalot

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game! My wife and I love games, but I noticed we had a lack of two player board games. I got her this for Christmas and it's been a huge hit. It's a great co-op game and even better with friends. It's challenging and difficult, but winnable. The only thing to watch out for is if someone you may play with tends to be a control freak, they could want to take over the game and just tell everyone what to do to win, which very quickly makes it no fun. But other than that, it's a fantastic game! Even for two players. Can also be a drinking game 😂
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: Great Team Game
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun because you get to play as a team to defeat the pandemic instead of playing against your friends. It's got the right amount of challenge. Sometimes you will win, other times you will lose which is just how a game like this should be.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for 2
customer_reviews.text: Took a few games to get all the rules. Ended up youtubing a tutorial. After learning, it's a great way to bond with your spouse! Love that you have to work as a team.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Overholt

customer_reviews.title: Great cooperative game!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and son (8 years) have played this game at least once a week since I gave it as a birthday present. I love it that they can play on the same team. No accusations of cheating or unfair moves, no getting upset when he loses (the boy not the husband, lol), and the game has different roles they can play so it's fresh each time. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: My family loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Want a bad a$$ cooperative game that is filled with tension, challenge, and crazy self satisfaction when you and your team wins? Buy this game! Easy to learn, but a real challenge to master. We've lost against this game numerous times when playing on harder difficulties, but my family and my gamer group always re-setup and go again, win or lose. Lots of tension against those super viruses, but the feeling that you and your team will overcome those challenges to save the world against them is what truly makes this game shine. Work together, and you will conquer! Highly recommended for family game night!
customer_reviews.author: Marc Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Very challenging!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of little rules and nuances to learn but very fun once you get the hang of it! Hubby and I have lost way more than we won! First few times we only won because we were actually cheating due to not quite getting all the rules, once we played by all the rules we started getting beat! We love trying and trying though! Great game for just 2!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and Addictive Game
customer_reviews.text: This game is amazing and surprisingly very addictive. I first played this with three of us and we kept losing over and over again. We were determined to get a victory. We did eventually and kept playing nightly. This is a great game with great gameplay. It is fun change to win or lose as a team instead of individually. My wife and I want to get the kids involved in this so we might pick up the dice version but for now, we get this out when we want a challenge and something different than what the kids play. I like that there are expansions for this and I will be checking them out.
customer_reviews.author: Scottypiper

customer_reviews.title: Teachable moments for family game night.
customer_reviews.text: The game is a step up from other cooperative games like forbidden desert. It’s been a hit with our family of seven and has helped my children start to think about how their particular role is best suited to help the team. What’s nice is that the game is quite challenging without being impossible. For younger kids a I’d recommend continuing to play with the novice settings for awhile as a lot of the team dynamics take some time to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: On the fence
customer_reviews.text: Just got this for Christmas thinking it looked intriguing. After reading the instructions I am super overwhelmed. Feels complex and slow paced. Haven’t had the time to actually try and play it yet. I hope it turns out to be fun. As a side note, I wasn’t able to submit this review with low stars???
customer_reviews.author: Elisa Scherzinger

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: My whole family loves playing this game. Nice that players work together to win against the disease rather than working against each other for their own win like most games. We played with all of our company (many different games) over Christmas break and everyone loved it so we bought more copies of the game to give them so they could play at home too and share the game with other friends. Pandemic is different every time you play depending on the character cards in play. Great way to spend time with people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended game for those who like co-player games. Definitely takes some used to getting to know the rules, but by the third game its a piece of cake. Every game you play is different. As I work in the public health industry, I have EXTRA fun!
customer_reviews.author: Lbatt

customer_reviews.title: Work as a team to save the world!
customer_reviews.text: We love playing Pandemic and saving the world together as a team. There is a learning curve and definite strategy involved. After a few rounds, your strategies will change and you will figure out all of the super powers of the different roles and how to use them to your advantage. Great fun!
customer_reviews.author: skier

customer_reviews.title: My favorite board game by far!
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome!! We were very overwhelmed with reading the instructions, but once we started playing, it all made sense. First few times playing, we kept the instructions handy for reference. We also love have small condiment size bowls for the disease cubes instead of playing with them in the bags. It’s my favorite board game by far, I’m excited to try an expansion soon!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin

customer_reviews.title: Great co-op game!
customer_reviews.text: Really fun game with lots of replay value. I play this with my wife and we both love it. It's nice to find a game that we're on the same team and that plays well with only two people. It takes a bit to learn, because a lot is going on, but the instructions are really well written.
customer_reviews.author: FishFishFish

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: This game sounded boring at first but we gave it a shot and I'm glad we did. What I like about it, is that it's co-op so you are all on the same team! It's rare to find a game like that, and this one is pretty awesome. It's especially nice for people who are too competitive or sore losers, since you all work together but operate independently.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Fun collaborative game
customer_reviews.text: So much fun! My husband and I love this game we’ve played it five times in the last week. It’s a great collaboration game that’s clear and way to pick up. We played just the two of us, but would definitely be fun with more
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome co-op experience!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing co-op game! If you’re an experienced board gamer, this will be easy to learn and get up and running. For those new to modern board games, the learning curve might be more but still totally doable in 30 mins or so. Overall, great strategy co-op experience!
customer_reviews.author: Dane R Bozman

customer_reviews.title: Fun Cooperative Family Game
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun cooperative family game. My youngest is 11 and enjoys the game, I don’t think she’d like it if she were too much younger though.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jane Quinn

customer_reviews.title: We love to play this game
customer_reviews.text: This became our favorite board game in our family. It's easy to learn even for my 6 year old, and it has a lot of replay value due to different roles that could be used. Also the difficulty of the game can be adjusted depending on who is playing.
customer_reviews.author: Hai

customer_reviews.title: No Idea in December 2019
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit this was hard to play mid February once Covid-19 was known worldwide. We played once after I bought it for Christmas. It is detailed and took a while to learn. We did not finish that one game as we ran out of time.
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Nardiello

customer_reviews.title: I haven't won a single game but it's so fun.
customer_reviews.text: This game makes me wonder how prepared we really are for actual pandemics. I've never won yet because, surprisingly, world-ending bacteria and viruses are difficult to combat, but it makes me want to play it more. It's really easy to pick up and becomes increasingly stressful, which is a great sign. But most of all, I particularly like this game because you work together with the other players instead of against them as you do in most strategy games.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Superb challenging yet rewarding game
customer_reviews.text: The game has a learning curve. But is extremely rewarding. And many people can play as teams (which is equally rewarding). The nature of the game is everyone works together, to beat the game. A fantastic team building game. The only con might be that it's less rewarding with only 2 people.
customer_reviews.author: JesSam

customer_reviews.title: Not that great of instructions on how and when to play a person's abilites.
customer_reviews.text: Its interesting but the instructions are pretty vague. Yes, I read them but I still had to figure out HOW some of the character's actions really worked. Example: one person can move people but it doesn't fully say when during the game. during their turn? any time? I had to google the specifics and ask a friend who played it. I gave it 4 because of this but it's not getting 3 stars because it is a fun game.
customer_reviews.author: LocoLogan

customer_reviews.title: Too many cooks in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game. Watch out you strong personality leader types. Success definitely depends on working as a team. If you start butting heads then you’re bound to fail and the world is doomed. Once we got the hang of it we found this easy with only 2 players. More players means more personalities and that’s when it get more challenging (and frustrating)
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Fun Intro to Cooperative Games
customer_reviews.text: Pandemic is one of the first cooperative games I ever played and it ignited my love of board games! Highly recommend this for those who are seasoned or new to board games. The game is easy to understand and has a ton of replay value. One thing to be cautious of is to make sure you don't overstep your bounds during someone else's turn. It's fun to talk through and debate options to make sure everyone's in agreement, but I would recommend giving everyone a chance to provide input (especially with folks who are new to Pandemic/cooperative games) instead of the more opinionated/vocal folks delegating everything. This makes for more engaging play.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca H

customer_reviews.title: Least fun game ever
customer_reviews.text: Honestly just a boring game. There is nothing fun about it. Just because something works mechanically doesn’t make it good. I can’t imagine the kind of person that likes this game. They must be an absolute goober.
customer_reviews.author: no

customer_reviews.title: Great game!  Working together instead of against each other is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT game to play with family or a few friends. Since it's cooperative (meaning everyone works together to reach a common goal), there's no sore losers. Either everyone wins or everyone loses, and you're working together for it. There's also enough different roles to play (giving you a "special" ability) that the strategies are never the same. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Shanken

customer_reviews.title: Fun, challenging, makes you think!!!
customer_reviews.text: This game is a nice change of pace. We usually play games where we compete and fight the entire game. This is a great teamwork game and very fun while also challenging. Somewhat difficult to understand on the first go round but it gets easier as you play and you really learn quickly you have to develop good strategic skills.
customer_reviews.author: Rector

product_meta.title: Pandemic
product_meta.description:
Four diseases have broken out in the world and it is up to a team of specialists in various fields to find cures for these diseases before mankind is wiped out. Players must work together playing to their characters' strengths and planning their strategy of eradication before the diseases overwhelm the world with ever-increasing outbreaks. For example the operation specialist can build research stations which are needed to find cures for the diseases. The Scientist needs only 4 cards of a particular disease to cure it instead of the normal 5. But the diseases are out breaking fast and time is running out: The team must try to stem the tide of infection in diseased areas while also towards cures. A truly cooperative game where you all win or you all lose.
